pros: Mon-Fri schedule, holidays off, some health benefits.
cons: Not enough dependable staff; unprofessional colleagues; poor communication from management.

job_title: Peer Recovery Coach in Westland, MI
pros: I have had the privilege of working with some of the best supervisor's in the field of SUD.
cons: Turnover is an ongoing issue.

review_title: Good place to gain experience as a new graduate but wouldn't recommend staying long.
job_title: Infant Mental Health Therapist in Westland, MI
pros:
- Good PTO. You accrue PTO at each pay period and my PTO requests, no matter how last minute, have always been approved. 
- Good supervision. I had free weekly supervision and my direct supervisor genuinely cared and gave me helpful feedback on cases. 
- It's Monday through Friday and you get 11 holidays off, which is nice.
cons:
- It's can be a stressful position because you're working with high needs clients. you often get referrals from CPS and/or foster care, so the cases are really consuming. 
- on call shifts. 
- The paperwork/administrative side at Hegira is your number one client. It makes it difficult to do the work that actually matters, which is with the people. There is also more micromanagement happening when it comes to administrative work and when clients cancel on us (which is out of our control.) 
- You're doing home-based work, so you're driving all over Wayne county for appointments and it's difficult to schedule clients.
- The pay isn't very good and there is no room for upward mobility. You're pretty much capped at 43,000 - 45,000 annually. 
- You're working a lot of evenings because most children and adults cannot meet until either the child is out of school and/or the parent is out of work, so it makes it very difficult to schedule. You have slow mornings but busy evenings.

review_title: Very good entry level into the field
pros: Supervisors are more than willing to walk you through your certification process every step of the way. And will thouroughly train you on your programs needs.
cons: Pay is on the lower end in the field.

pros: Very easy to get a job in the field
cons: Not worth the time or energy, and they overwork employees without compensation

job_title: Community Health Navigator in Detroit, MI
pros: Great management! Provides a team environment...
cons: High turnover in some departments and low pay

review_title: Outdated Clinical and Management Practices, misleading and disorganized
pros:
-Good EHR and exceptional IT department
-nice & clean office building
-good company wide on-boarding (poor department specific)
-great access to trainings: superior training in suicide prevention for all levels of employees
cons:
-tense and toxic office culture
- discourages team collaboration, negatively impacting daily operations ,client care, and individual workloads. seemed there was purposeful red tape to keep billing and clinical teams to never communicate which was unusual..
- outdated clinical environment norms: lacking client-centered care, trauma-informed care, and upper leadership not integrated with employees
- high turnover resulting in missing or no procedures for basic clinical operations
-position described was akin to private practice setting within larger behavioral health system but it is basically CMH and anything you'd expect to come with that

pros: This company promotes from within.
cons: Training in this company is lacking

job_title: Home Based Therapist in Detroit, MI
pros: It’s a (low salaried) job… offers supervision if needed
cons: Low paying, awful management, racist practices, hostile work environment almost anything bad about a job you can think of, this place has it. Turnover is high for a reason, run!!!!

job_title: Mobile Crisis Specialist in Livonia, MI
pros: The pay is above average, support from management is good
cons: Need to train new hires well

pros: The best company I've worked for!
cons: Nothing that I can think of yet.

job_title: Clinical Operations Coordinator in Livonia, MI
pros: A career at HPI provides ongoing opportunities to  learn, grow and advance.  Great benefits, wonderful people, and valuable work. In my time with HPI, I saw the company demonstrate genuine care and compassion for its employees, as well as for the people they served. I also met some of the smartest, kindest and strongest people I've ever encountered. Do not listen to the negative hype, Hegira is a great place to work.
cons: Sometimes the work is very difficult and the pay could be better. However, the problem with pay highlights a problem that is much greater than just HPI. As long as government funds to Medicaid and social service programs continue to be cut, the skills and achievements of social workers (and other helping professions) will continue to be undervalued and underfunded by our society. Fewer dollars to fund programs can result in low/stagnent wages, high caseload, staff turnover and unmet need in the community.

pros: Working for Hegira, is a great lesson in teaching one the type of business model they do not want to be affiliated with.
cons: Management is very poor at professional communication, training tailored to any positions outside of therapists, behavior, and owning their lack of ability to manage effectively.   Their non-management turnover remains so very high, in spite of their replacing particular management personnel within the last 5 years, speaks clearly on their behalf.

job_title: Children's Outpatient Therapist in Westland, MI
pros: Coworkers were wonderful and supportive. This is a good job for someone right out of grad school that needs supervision hours and clinical experience.
cons: The salary was not respectable for our profession, especially for how hard of work and the amount of responsibilities we had to manage on a daily basis. Unfortunately there is a high turnover rate for therapists, clients will even ask when you are planning on leaving. The caseloads are extremely high and you are expected to do clerical related tasks that add up and get in the way of providing direct therapeutic care. There was also little to no room for advancement within the company, and even then the pay for the promotion was not worth the extra responsibilities. Unfortunately they do very little to try to keep you after you become fully licensed.

pros: Wonderful coworkers, supportive middle management (albeit ineffective), okay benefit package
cons: Low pay, high turnover, ineffective middle management, high caseloads, high stress, NO support from upper management, unsafe surroundings and building, ineffective security, lazy IT department, old equipment (computers, company vans)

review_title: Unprofessional management - no training COPE IS NOT COPING!!!
pros: Benefits , and some co workers who actually care about the field.  There isn't many things positive to say! Truth!!!
cons:
Management frequently asks employees to lie to contract holders and executives.  They are inconsistent with their policies and training. Very confusing to say the least ,since you  only learn from co workers. 
Often administrators and assistant trainer are in exclusive meetings behind closed doors. 
Management complains to their employees about EXECUTIVE ignorance and never really addresses the issues at hand.
There is talk of employees filing lawsuits due to unfair treatment , hostile work environment ! It really is a volatile work environment!

pros: vacation time accumulation, a paycheck
cons: Under staffed.  Lack of support from upper Management.  You are just a number which is underpaid to line the pockets of executives.  High turn over rate which is not addressed, excuses are made to cover up the underlying issues.  The biggest disappointment of my work career to date.

review_title: Excellent opportunities to learn and grow in your therapeutic practice
pros: Lots of continuing education opportunities and trainings, supportive coordinators and administrators, good PTO policy, collaborative teams, meaningful work with families and children, flexible work schedule
cons: This is Community Mental Health. Pay isn't going to be stellar, and there is a lot of paperwork. Caseloads are heavy with families and children who have experienced significant trauma, so there can be burnout for some individuals.

pros: Good PTO, benefits, and pay is average. Ability to work directly with SMI and make a difference in their lives.
cons: Upper management is condescending and overly confident. Need to listen to the employee and let them problem solve issues with clients. Middle level management is supportive and dedicated to the employees and mission.

review_title: Great coworkers; Out of touch upper management
pros: Lots of talented mental health professionals seem to start out here so coworker support is amazing; good benefits
cons: they have financial planning issues.  Higher ups are clueless, condescending, unappreciative of the stressful work lower level employees do.

pros: It is nice to give a human connection to people in crisis.
cons: The management is opprissive and condescending. It's a weekend job that requires multiple trainings during the week. I used up my pto at my full time job to attend mandated trainings such as safe driving.

pros: Good health insurance & benefits after 30 days. Outside of health insurance benefits, this was my worst employment experience as a therapist.
cons: Terrible place to work. Management was very disorganized and condescending. Worst employment experience I have had in the last 10yrs as a therapist. I received no supervision even when I requested supervision for clinical reviews, and learned documentation details as time went on by asking questions to coworkers.

review_title: Not a bad place to start out.
